009package Filters;
010import java.util.Random;
011
012import ij.ImagePlus;
013import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
014import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
015import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilter;
016import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilterVector;
017import imagingbook.common.image.data.PixelPack;
018
019/**
020 * Implementation of the "Jitter filter" based on the {@link GenericFilter}
021 * class. Works for all image types, using nearest-border-pixel strategy.
022 * The input image is destructively modified.
023 * See the inner class {@link JitterFilter} for the actual implementation
024 * of the filter.
025 * 
026 * @author WB
027 * @version 2021/01/12
028 */
029public class Jitter_Filter_GenericFilter implements PlugInFilter {
030        
031        private static final int RAD = 3;       // the radius (should be user-specified)
032                
033        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
034                return DOES_ALL;
035        }
036
037        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
038                GenericFilter filter = new JitterFilter();      // see below
039                filter.applyTo(ip);
040        }
041        
042        // --------------------------------------------------------------
043        
044        /**
045         * This inner class actually implements the Jitter filter,
046         * based on the functionality provided by {@link GenericFilter}.
047         */
048        private static class JitterFilter extends GenericFilterVector {
049                private final int dist = 2 * RAD + 1;   // width/height of the "kernel"
050                private final Random rnd = new Random();
051                
052                @Override
053                protected float[] doPixel(PixelPack source, int u, int v) {
054                        int rx = rnd.nextInt(dist) - RAD;
055                        int ry = rnd.nextInt(dist) - RAD;
056                        return source.getVec(rx, ry);
057                }
058        }
059        
060}
